Under LAW of the code of civil procedure , a lawyer whose client is of poor means can declare to have advanced the costs and expenses of the proceedings on behalf of his client and not to have been paid his fees ( onorari ) , and can accordingly request that , if his client is successful and is thus entitled under LAW to be awarded legal costs , the court discharge the latter directly to the lawyer ( distrazione delle spese ) ( see , for example , PERSON , judgment No .
